data.question: What is the main goal of the synthesis approach described in the text?
data.answer: The main goal is to transform microporous MOFs into hierarchical micro- and mesoporous MOFs using a simple hydrolytic post-synthetic procedure.

data.question: What is the name of the new microporous MOF synthesized as a proof of concept?
What range of mesopore sizes was achieved through the hydrolytic transformation?
Can the degree of micro- and mesoporosity be controlled in the synthesis process?
data.answer: Yes, by adjusting the time and temperature of hydrolysis.

data.question: Is the original microporous structure completely lost after transformation?
data.answer: No, the original microporous structure is maintained, at least in part.

data.question: True or False: The hierarchical porous MOF, POST-66(Y)-wt, cannot encapsulate nanometer-sized guests.
True or False: Most MOFs are unstable in water.
What happens to the surface area and total specific pore volume after water treatment?
data.answer: The surface area decreases significantly, while the total specific pore volume increases.

data.question: What method was used to calculate the pore-size distribution profile?
True or False: The transformation process from microporous to mesoporous MOF is irreversible.
What was used as a dissolution agent to create additional mesopores?
How was the leaching of metal ions and ligand monitored?
data.answer: By ICP-AES and UV/Vis spectroscopy, respectively.

data.question: True or False: The hydrolytic transformation is only applicable to POST-66(Y).
What effect does increasing the temperature for water treatment have on the transformation process?
data.answer: It proceeds more rapidly and generates larger mesopores.

data.question: True or False: The hierarchical porous MOF can be used to immobilize large guest molecules such as proteins and enzymes.
What was the observed effect of encapsulating an enzyme in the hierarchical MOF?
True or False: The method described requires elaborate synthetic procedures to produce mesopores.
What is the role of hydrolytic post-synthetic transformation in MOFs?
data.answer: It generates larger pores by partial removal of constituents.

data.question: True or False: The mesoporous transformation of POST-66(Y) occurs in a single stage.
What is the significance of the work supported by the Institute for Basic Science (IBS)?
data.answer: It presents a new approach to constructing hierarchical micro- and mesoporous MOFs from microporous MOFs through a hydrolytic process.
